current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To permit the continuation of certain health plans.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text: Keeping the Affordable Care Act Promise Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (or an amendment made by that Act). Coverage to which this section applies shall be deemed to be minimum essential coverage for purposes of
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

text.#text:
Notwithstanding any other provision of law, an individual 
        may elect to continue enrollment under the health insurance 
        coverage (offered in the individual market) in which such individual was enrolled on December 31, 2013, if such individual meets such other eligibility requirements (such as payment of premiums) as are applied with respect to such coverage, unless such issuer cancels all coverage offered in such market and ceases operations as a health insurance issuer. Any such coverage shall be deemed to be a grandfathered health plan for purposes of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1251

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Part 2 of subtitle C of title I of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/t:I/st:C/pt:2

header.#text: Transparency of grandfathered health plan notifications
Transparency of grandfathered health plan notifications

text.#text: A health insurance issuer that offers health insurance coverage in the individual market shall annually, at the time of enrollment and renewal, provide enrollees with a notice that states—

if applicable, the reasons that such coverage does not meet the requirements under this Act (or amendment made by this Act) for a qualified health plan, including citations to the provisions of this Act involved;
that the enrollee has the right to continue to enroll in such coverage; and
that the enrollee has the right to enroll in a qualified health plan offered through an Exchange and instruction on how to access such Exchange.

A notification provided by a health insurance issuer, that offers health insurance coverage in the individual market, to an enrollee stating that such coverage is cancelled for such enrollee shall contain a statement of the reasons for such cancellation, including a reference to any provision of this Act (or an amendment made by this Act) that such issuer relied upon in making the determination to cancel such coverage.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall apply beginning on the date of enactment of this section, except that with respect to a health plan that has provided a notification of cancellation prior to such date that has not yet taken effect, an enrollee may elect to continue such coverage under such plan if the issuer continues to offer such plan as provided for in
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1251A/ss:b

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and the issuer shall provide a subsequent notification to the enrollee that states—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Keeping the Affordable Care Act Promise Act/s:2

short-title.#text: Keeping the Affordable Care Act Promise Act

text.#text: that such plan will remain in effect at the option of the enrollee; and
the reasons that such plan does not otherwise meet the requirements under this Act for a qualified health plan.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S1642 IS: Keeping the Affordable Care Act Promise Act
